issue.title: GUI crashes in regtest
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current behaviour

The GUI crashes in regtest immediately on start. It did work once initially but has been crashing since, tried quite a few times.

### Expected behaviour

The GUI should not crash in regtest, just like it doesn't in main or test environments.

### Steps to reproduce

Following is the command I have used. Also, tried a few variants of the `-datadir, -walletdir` args by adding and removing `/regtest`.

```
➜  bitcoin git:(master) ✗ ./build/bin/bitcoin-qt -datadir=/Users/rkrux/Library/ApplicationSupport/Bitcoin/regtest -conf=/Users/rkrux/Library/ApplicationSupport/Bitcoin/bitcoin-reg.conf -walletdir=/Users/rkrux/Library/ApplicationSupport/Bitcoin/regtest/wallets
```

Error received in the UI and the terminal.
```
Error: SQLiteDatabase: Failed to configure serialized threading mode: bad parameter or other API misuse
```

### Relevant log output

```zsh
2025-12-17T10:22:15Z Bitcoin Core version v30.99.0-13891a8a685d (release build)
2025-12-17T10:22:15Z parameter interaction: -bind set -> setting -listen=1
2025-12-17T10:22:15Z Qt 6.9.0 (dynamic), plugin=cocoa
2025-12-17T10:22:15Z No static plugins.
2025-12-17T10:22:15Z Style: macos / QMacStyle
2025-12-17T10:22:15Z System: macOS Sequoia (15.4), x86_64-little_endian-lp64
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z GUI: QFSFileEngine::open: No file name specified
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z GUI: QFSFileEngine::open: No file name specified
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z GUI: QFSFileEngine::open: No file name specified
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z GUI: QFSFileEngine::open: No file name specified
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z GUI: QFSFileEngine::open: No file name specified
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Using RdSeed as an additional entropy source
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Using RdRand as an additional entropy source
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Default data directory /Users/rkrux/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Using data directory /Users/rkrux/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/regtest
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Config file: /Users/rkrux/Library/ApplicationSupport/Bitcoin/bitcoin-reg.conf
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Config file arg: regtest="1"
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Config file arg: [regtest] bind="127.0.0.1:28334"
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Config file arg: [regtest] bind="127.0.0.1:28335=onion"
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Config file arg: [regtest] port="28333"
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Config file arg: [regtest] rpcpassword=****
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Config file arg: [regtest] rpcport="28332"
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Config file arg: [regtest] rpcuser=****
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Setting file arg: wallet = ["test"]
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Command-line arg: conf="/Users/rkrux/Library/ApplicationSupport/Bitcoin/bitcoin-reg.conf"
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Command-line arg: walletdir="/Users/rkrux/Library/ApplicationSupport/Bitcoin/regtest/wallets"
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Using at most 125 automatic connections (1024 file descriptors available)
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z scheduler thread start
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Using wallet directory /Users/rkrux/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/regtest/wallets
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z Using SQLite Version 3.43.2
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z init message: Verifying wallet(s)…
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z [warning] SQLite Error. Code: 21. Message: misuse at line 185687 of [1b37c146ee]
2025-12-17T10:22:16Z [error] SQLiteDatabase: Failed to configure serialized threading mode: bad parameter or other API misuse

2025-12-17T10:22:20Z Shutdown done
```

### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core

Compiled from source

### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using?

master@13891a8a685d255cb13dd5018e3d5ccc18b07c34

### Operating system and version

MacOS Sequoia (15.4)

### Machine specifications

_No response_

events.body: Can you check the directory permissions please
